name: Let 'The Guardian' guard you Quiz / Test | Authors | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is unique about the O'Malley family?
questions.explanation:
they're not  blood relations.

	Kate and Marcus met in the orphanage and decided to form a family of brothers and sisters. Slowly, they invited the five others into the group and when they were eighteen they legally changed their last name to O'Malley.

federal marshall.

	Marcus is a federal marshall who has a partner named Quinn Diamond.

questions.text: When Marcus and Quinn were talking about the O'Malley sisters that Quinn had asked out in the past, which one of the sisters did he ask out two years ago?
questions.explanation:
Jennifer.

	Marcus (to Quinn): "Two years ago you asked out Jennifer--she's now engaged; last year you asked out Kate--she's now serious with an FBI agent; this year you asked out Lisa. You just told Lisa she's your third choice. Rachel might forgive you; Lisa will never let you forget it."

questions.text: Which member of the Hanford family died of their wounds?
questions.explanation:
William.

	Shari's brother Josh was shot pushing her out of the way of the shooter's bullet. Her father, William, died of his wounds. Shari wasn't shot and neither was her mother, Beth. Marcus was with Shari when her father died.

questions.text: What does Shari do for a living?
questions.explanation:
speech writer.

	Marcus met Shari at a dinner for the Supreme Court judges. He later protected her when she witnessed one of the judges being killed.

questions.text: Which two O'Malley siblings kidnapped Rugsby, the family mascot?
questions.explanation:
Jennifer and Rachel.

	Marcus is helping them with ransom demands.

questions.text: Which two federal marshalls were shot during this story?
questions.explanation:
Quinn and Marcus.

	Quinn was winged by the shooter in the stairwell not long after the judge was killed and Marcus was winged in the church during William's funeral.

questions.text: What was unique about the blood sample that Lisa O'Malley found in the hotel room of the shooter?
questions.correct: it belonged to a dead man
options: it belonged to one of her brothers
questions.explanation:
it belonged to a dead man.

	Because there was a trace amount of blood, when Lisa ran the sample through the computer it came up belonging to a dead man. Because that was impossible, they linked the shooter to a family member of the man that died.

questions.text: Where does Marcus take Shari when they find out there is a hit out on her?
questions.explanation:
Quinn's ranch.

	Because they need somewhere safe and hard to get to, Quinn suggests his ranch in Montana. Marcus and Quinn take her there until the grand jury convenes and she can testify.

questions.text: Shari decided to run for Congress at the end of the book?
questions.explanation:
True.

	She always wanted to, but Marcus was the one that talked her into moving forward.
